label: name
comment: The name of the project

label: experience
comment: Describes the experience that is required.

label: handling
comment: Describes the requirements for the specific handling of objects.

label: identifier
comment: Represents the unique identifier of the element.

label: knwoledge
comment: Describes the knowledge that is required.

label: mission
comment: Describes the mission or goal of a business process (flow).

label: owner
comment: Represents the owner of a business process (flow).

label: person responsible
comment: States whether someone is responsible for the SubprocessDiagram or not.

label: remark or example
comment: Denotes a remark or an example that is given specific to an element.

label: requirements
comment: Description of all requirements for the certain input or output.

label: scope
comment: Denotes the scope of a specific business process (flow).

label: transaction code
comment: Contains the transaction code assigned to a Screen in SAP.

label: additional property
comment: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.

label: customer part number
comment: Product identifier used by the customer to identify one IFX product

label: delivery lead time
comment: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup.

label: finished product number
comment: finishedProductNumber is the unique identifier for a FinishedProduct

label: halogen free
comment: Free of halogen is a material classification. These are materials that emit limited smoke and no halogen when exposed to high sources of heat.

label: halogen free
comment: halogen free states if a SalesProduct is halogen free or not.

label: location
comment: A Location within Infineons internal supply chain is a local area where products are manufactured or stored.

label: location
comment: A Location within Infineons internal supply chain is a local area where products are manufactured or stored.

label: orderable part number
comment: Customers may use the OPN as their customer part number for ordering at Infineon. It is based on product attributes

label: sales product name
comment:
In verbal communication it is usually identified by Sales Product Name (SPN) which might not be sufficient for unique identification.
It reflects a product from customer view without differentiation of manufacturing route or storage location ( form  fit  function ).

label: sales product number
comment: A salesProductNumber is a unique identifier of a Sales Product

label: has anticipation capabilities
comment: Anticipatory activities are used by a DECISION-MAKING UNIT to take into account the characteristics and the situation of other DECISION-MAKING UNITs in course of its own decision making (Schneeweiss 2003).

label: costs
comment: Cost refers to the amount of money that is needed to do a certain action for a unit of a certain good, for instance, store or produce a unit of a product.

label: costs
comment: Cost refers to the amount of money that is needed to do a certain action for a unit of a certain good, for instance, store or produce a unit of a product.

label: decision rights
comment: This property will allow a DECISION-MAKING UNIT to negotiate the instruction provided by other DECISION-MAKING UNIT. In a conventional or strict hierarchical setting, negotiations of instruction provided by superior DECISION-MAKING UNITs are impossible. In a distributed hierarchical setting in the sense of Schneeweiss (2003) reactions of the DECISION-MAKING UNIT which can lead to negotiations are possible (Schneeweiss 2003).

label: decision time
comment: This property describes the point of time when a decision is made by the DECISION-MAKING UNIT.

label: due date
comment: This is the latest time where the activities associated with a PLANNING OBJECT have to be finished. Note that the parameter DUE DATE is exogenous, i.e. given, in contrast to the property TIME.

label: due date
comment: This is the latest time where the activities associated with a PLANNING OBJECT have to be finished. Note that the parameter DUE DATE is exogenous, i.e. given, in contrast to the property TIME.

label: due date
comment: This is the latest time where the activities associated with a PLANNING OBJECT have to be finished. Note that the parameter DUE DATE is exogenous, i.e. given, in contrast to the property TIME.

label: due date
comment: This is the latest time where the activities associated with a PLANNING OBJECT have to be finished. Note that the parameter DUE DATE is exogenous, i.e. given, in contrast to the property TIME.

label: earliest release date
comment: This is the earliest time where the activities associated with a PLANNING OBJECT can start. Note that the parameter RELEASE DATE is exogenous, i.e. given, in contrast to the property TIME.

label: end time
comment: This is the latest point in time when the PLANNING CONSTRAINT is active.

label: feasibility status
comment: A PLAN is feasible if all PLANNING CONSTAINTS of the PLANNING INSTANCE on which the plan is based are fulfilled, otherwise, the plan is infeasible.

label: hard constraints
comment: PLANNING CONSTRAINTS with this property cannot be violated.

label: identifier
comment: Each PLANNING OBJECT has a unique identifier, abbreviated by ID.

label: information status
comment: This property describes the own internal, but also the external situation of the DECISION-MAKING UNIT. At the same time, it describes information about the internal and external situation of other DECISION-MAKING UNITs and their information status (Schneeweiss 2003).

label: level
comment: Each vertex has a level. The highest level is assigned to vertices that do not receive instructions from other vertices. The vertices belonging to the second highest level receive instructions only from vertices of the highest level. This definition can be repeated in a recursive manner. Reactions are only possible from vertices of level k-1 to vertices of level k or level k-1.

label: level
comment: Each vertex has a level. The highest level is assigned to vertices that do not receive instructions from other vertices. The vertices belonging to the second highest level receive instructions only from vertices of the highest level. This definition can be repeated in a recursive manner. Reactions are only possible from vertices of level k-1 to vertices of level k or level k-1.

label: maximum computing time
comment: This property specifies which maximum time is allowed to perform a certain planning activity.

label: number of operations on same resource
penality costs
comment: If CONSTRAINTS are violated by a plan penalties might be used to change the performance measure values to express that the violations are undesired.

label: planning period
comment: This property defines a certain fraction of a planning window. Equidistant periods are common for many supply chain planning problems.

label: planning window
comment: A planning window described for which amount of periods or which time span the performance measure values have to be calculated. In some situations, the planning window will determine the set of planning objects, for instance, lots completed within the planning window.

label: planning window
comment: A planning window described for which amount of periods or which time span the performance measure values have to be calculated. In some situations, the planning window will determine the set of planning objects, for instance, lots completed within the planning window.

label: priority
comment: This property describes the relative importance of the PLANNING OBJECT. It provided the base for establishing a partial ordering of the importance of the set of planning objects.

label: quantity
comment: This property describes given, i.e. fixed, size of a PLANNING OBJECT, for instance, the number of wafers that belong to a lot. Note that the parameter QUANTITY is exogenous, i.e. given, in contrast to the property QUANTITY where the amount of the quantity has to be decided.

label: quantity
comment: This property describes given, i.e. fixed, size of a PLANNING OBJECT, for instance, the number of wafers that belong to a lot. Note that the parameter QUANTITY is exogenous, i.e. given, in contrast to the property QUANTITY where the amount of the quantity has to be decided.

label: revenue
comment: Revenue refers to the amount of income, earning generated by the sale of one unit of a certain good.

label: soft constraints
comment: PLANNING CONSTRAINTS with this property can be violated. This means that the degree of violation is typically penalized in a related criterion or performance measure.

label: start time
comment: This is the earliest point in time when the PLANNING CONSTRAINT is active.

label: time
comment: This property is required to manage timing aspects of a PLANNING OBJECT. It can be a release time, a finishing time, a single start time, or a set of start time for certain ACTIVITIES to be fulfilled.

label: weights
comment: Weights can be used to express preferences of the decision makers among the different performance measures and related criteria. This is, for instance, useful if a lexicographic approach is used.

label: description
comment: Description of the Object/Entity

label: WIP costs per unit and time unit
comment: Target Costs: Capital bounding costs + Storage costs + Mean production costs of a unit of a certain technology and time unit

label: capacity loss
comment: Calendar: Facility capacity loss in percent

label: chips per wafer
comment: Product Level 4: Number of chips on a wafer

comment: PK; customer wish time of the demand entry

comment: Cycle Time Commitment: Committed overall supply chain cycle time
